# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Below is the function `wrap_string` in Julia, which reads a string and a desired maximum width, then outputs the string with new lines inserted to ensure that each line does not exceed the specified width, based on word boundaries.

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    current_line_length = 0
    result = []
    
    for word in words
        word_length = length(word)
        if current_line_length + word_length > text_width
            push!(result, '\n')
            current_line_length = 0
        elseif current_line_length > 0
            push!(result, ' ')
            current_line_length += 1
        end
        push!(result, word)
        current_line_length += word_length
    end
    
    return join(result)
end
```

**Example Usage:**

```julia
input_text = "Julia is a high-level, high-performance programming language for technical computing."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(input_text, 20)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This function will output `input_text` with new lines so that no line will be wider than 20 characters, respecting word boundaries.
